content:
You could change the colour of unread mail, but it requires some customisation. Some people feel a bit daunted when they need to go into areas of Thunderbird that they would not normally do. However, the following is not as difficult as first imagined because it only requires this skillset:

  • Ability to follow instructions
  • Ability to create a folder
  • Ability to copy and paste text
  • Ability to save a file

You do not need to actually know how to code because I'm supplying all the code and full instructions.

First: Please check in Thunderbird to see if a setting needs switching on. - see attached image as guide.

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say 'TRUE'

Now Do this: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder.

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.

I'm going to give the full instructions because I do not know if people already know how to create and use a userChrome.css file.

  • In the 'profile name ' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case. - see attached image as guide.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'. 
@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css");   /* Set colour of unread in thread pane/message list */ #threadTree tbody [data-properties~="unread"] { color: #2492d1 !important;  }

Note: the code uses the colour blue - this is the hex code: #2492d1 But you can choose whatever colour you prefer. This link may help you choose a colour and locate the hex code number. The hex code always starts with a hash key.

  • https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_picker.asp
  • Save the file as 'userChrome.css' - note the spelling of this is important - all lower case except the C.
  • Save it in the 'chrome' folder. - see attached image as guide.

Check that file really is called 'userChrome.css' and not 'userChrome.css.txt' - it has to be saved as a Cascading Style Sheet (css) and not a text document. - see attached image as guide. So if you see 'userChrome.css.txt' - no problem - just rename it by removing the .txt - you will get asked are you sure as it may effect things - just say yes because you really do want to do it.

Start Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Hi Toad-hall: Thanks so much for such a comprehensive reply, and for sharing your deep expertise. I did what you so carefully described, but nothing happened! I made one mistake and perhaps you can tell me if it was fatal. When you said "Exit Thunderbird now. This is important" I closed the Thunderbird window, but I did not quit the program. I now realise when you said Exit, this is what you meant. So I have the folder in my profile and the userChrome.css file saved in it. But by leaving Thunderbird open I may have failed to link it to the program. Is there a short cut now to making it work, or should I start over and move the folder to trash? Thanks for all your help. Clive
creator: clivechafer

content: More information may help. The default account is not related to the unified view, and that may be part of the issue. If responding to a message, the related email account should be used, but that isn't part of your concern, from what you wrote. if you highlight an account, then clicking 'new message' should use that account for composition. That is, if viewing a message in unified view and responding, the account email is used, not the default.
creator: davidsk

content:
If a non-gmail account is sending through the gmail smtp, gmail automatically inserts the gmail address as the sending account. You should have separate smtp servers for each account, and set each account to send on the correct smtp:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310
creator: sfhowes

I just have to remember to double check each email, but sometimes i miss it, Iis frustrating.

content: This sounds like that folder may be threaded. Here is how to undo that: - highlight the folder on main view screen - above the message list pane is a button 'quick filter' and a small icon to its right, click that - on the drop-down menu, click sort by and tick 'unthreaded.'

content:
The Global Search article here (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/global-search) doesn't touch on the issue above.

However, when searching not via Global Search, e.g. via the Search Messages dialog box, two character searches yielded results, albeit obviously from only a single mailbox at a time.

Anyone know why this is a limitation of Global Search only and if it can be rectified?
creator: lookingtolearn

content:
It seems based on the discussion in the link here (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1096668), Global Search has a indexing limitation..."minimum word length TB will index is 3 characters", according to @Toad-Hall, https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/Toad-Hall/

In my experience it also ignores 3 characters if one of them is a "." or ":" etc.

Can this be fixed so that Global Search indexes 2 and 1 character and non-alphanumeric characters?
creator: lookingtolearn

content:
Per esportare le rubriche:

  1. Apri la scheda Rubrica di Thunderbird
  2. Click destro sul nome di una rubrica -> Esporta
  3. Salva la rubrica nel formato .csv
  4. Ripeti per ognuna delle rubriche che hai creato

Per Importare le rubriche:

  1. Apri la scheda Rubrica di Thunderbird
  2. Click pulsante e segui la procedura guidata scgliendo .csv come formato di importazione
  3. Ripeti per ognuna delle rubriche che hai esportato

Per la dimensione del profilo: 97 GB possono essere tanti o pochi a seconda di quanta posta conservi e cosa contiene (per esempio allegati pesanti). Per ridurre il peso puoi usare la funzione Compatta cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle ma prima è sempre consigliato un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird
